thread.section_title: Business News, Economy, Finance & ASX Market News
thread.title: More high-rise for Box Hill

author: Nicole Lindsay
title: More high-rise for Box Hill
text:
820 Whitehorse Road set a record for land value in the Box Hill CBD of $10,588 a square metre.
Another tower is set for the Box Hill skyline after a local developer paid $18.18 million for a two-storey office building.
The former Department of Human Services offices at 820 Whitehorse Road is two doors down from the Deague family's Asian Pacific Group's $330 million 511-apartment Whitehorse Towers project.
The Deagues paid the Skilled Engineering Hargraves family $14.135 million for their former office building on Whitehorse Road last year.
The new development site is also down the road from the new 20-storey Australian Tax Office at 990 Whitehorse Road.
Advertisement This new deal sets a record for land value in the Box Hill CBD of $10,588 a square metre, smashing the benchmark of $8200 set earlier in the month on Station Street.
Savills agent Nick Peden, who negotiated the sale with Jesse Radische and Clinton Baxter, said 17 expressions of interest were lodged out of more than 150 inquiries from a range of local and offshore developers.
The new owner, a small private developer, is planning to build a tower with a minimum of 25 levels on the 1722-square-metre site in Box Hill's Prospect Street Activity Precinct.
Records show the vendor, a passive investment company called Southleigh, paid $2.315 million for the 1835-square-metre building in 1996.
Mr Baxter said, "With apartment projects selling extraordinarily well – some are selling out off-the-plan within days or weeks of release – it was a must-consider opportunity for developers."
